meanings.definition: To surpass in delivering goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The new courier service will outdeliver the competition with faster deliveries.
meanings.sent2: Our company always aims to outdeliver our customers' expectations.
meanings.sent3: The pizza delivery guy decided to outdeliver himself by arriving in a superhero costume.
meanings.sent4: She managed to outdeliver her previous record by delivering all the packages in record time.
meanings.sent5: The company's commitment to outdelivering competitors made them the top choice for customers.

meanings.definition: To exceed expectations in delivering results.
meanings.sent1: The team worked hard to outdeliver their performance from last year.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained rigorously to outdeliver his personal best in the upcoming race.
meanings.sent3: The magician promised to outdeliver his previous tricks at the next show.
meanings.sent4: The student managed to outdeliver all others in the class with her outstanding project.
meanings.sent5: The chef's ability to outdeliver on taste and presentation set him apart in the culinary world.
